data.author: Nev Rawlins

changelog.release_notes: Added support for Pebble Time, Pebble Time Steel, Pebble Time Round, Pebble 2 and Quick Views.

data.description:
The display presents a faceted geometric cube shape.   The facets are blocks on the display.  The time telling method is a simple analog format.  

The hours are told by the inner ring of facets in traditional positions, with the relevant facet changing to an outlined shape.  
5-minutes facets are in the outer ring, again in traditional positions.  4 additional single minutes are on the sides of the inner cube.

The PM indicator changes the top of the inner cube to an outlined shape.


Screenshots show:  
(1)   5:28PM 
(2) 11:34AM
(3) 12:20AM
(4) 10:42AM (with Quick View)


Design created by Peter Fletcher and originally appeared on the Tokyoflash Design Studio.   It is published with the designer's permission, and sanctioned by Tokyoflash.   

The original design can be found here: 
http://blog.tokyoflash.com/2013/01/17/hypercube-lcd-version/

To see other sanctioned Tokyoflash watchfaces, click on "More from this Developer".

latest_release.release_notes: Added support for Pebble Time, Pebble Time Steel, Pebble Time Round, Pebble 2 and Quick Views.

data.title: Hypercube

data.description:
Bubble watch is a Watchface for the ones who like animated things. The time is shown using 75 bubbles. And when the clock ticks, a beautiful animation will change the digits.

ATTENTION: This watch face use a lot of resources and may be a bit laggy sometimes.
ATTENTION: BubbleWatch can drain a lot of battery.

ATTENTION: There is ABSOLUTELY NO EASTER EGG, so don't try to shake the watch to much (or to long). Bubbles wouldn't start to fly around (would they? :D )

Also check out my other WatchFace (FlexWatch), it's minimalistic, but show you all you need when you shake ;)

latest_release.release_notes:
Version 1.0:
- First Release
- Animations
- Bubbles
- Seconds

data.description:
Note: If compass doesn't work on installation, wait for a few minutes.


Have you found difficulty meeting your religious obligations on the go? Confused about when the next prayer time is at your location? Or simply find the tedium of searching for your local salat updates too much to bear? Worry no more. Salat Pro makes the latest prayer times, optimised to your location, available on the go. This groundbreaking watchface displays your next due prayer, the time at which it occurs at your precise location, and your current time, so you can coordinate your everyday life around your religious obligations at the flick of a wrist. In addition, a handy pointer, prominently located on the watchface, employs the Pebble’s compass capabilities in order to indicate the direction to Mecca, constituting your very own mini Qibla! Never has it been so easy to know when and where to pray! Leveraging the Pebble’s unprecedented capabilities and pushing them to their very limits, this bleeding-edge technology is truly at the forefront of innovation, boasting the most powerful and accurate Salat engine on the market. Rejoice; the weekly routines of missing a prayer are now gone by!
data.title: Salat Pro

data.description:
A design from the Tokyoflash Design Studio, created by Peter Fletcher that combines both the original and the digital versions.    You switch between them using a sharp shake of the wrist.  

For both, one line of the “X” shape displays the hours. The other line, divided into two by the hours, displays 5 x 10 minutes (bottom left) and 9 single minutes (top right).   


Screenshots:  
(1) Animation, running from 10:53 to 11:01, showing switching between the 2 modes on a wrist shake.
(2) 11:23 (original blocks) 
(3) 23:58 (digital) 


This watchface is published with the designer's permission, and sanctioned by Tokyoflash.   

Pete's original design for both versions (digital was in one of Peter's comments) can be found here: http://blog.tokyoflash.com/2014/05/28/type-x-watch-makes-its-mark-on-your-wrist/  

If you don't want both watchfaces, go for one of the single face versions - search for "Type-X".

latest_release.release_notes: Added support for Pebble Time / Pebble Time Steel / Pebble Time Round / Pebble 2 and Quick Views

data.author: N-MAN

changelog.release_notes:
First Release
Shake the watch to reset the initial setup to one of 3 different settings!

data.description:
This watchface displays the time overlaid on a running simulation of John Conway's Game of Life. Shake the watch to reset the game to one of three initial setups.

Rules of the Game of Life:
For each cycle of the game...
- A live (black) square remains live if and only if it has exactly 2 or 3 live neighbors. Otherwise it dies (turns white)
- A non-live square becomes live if it has exactly 3 neighbors. Otherwise it stays non-live

Note: A portion of the code for this watchface was taken from the tutorial on the pebble website, since it was created by modifying that tutorial

latest_release.release_notes:
First Release
Shake the watch to reset the initial setup to one of 3 different settings!

data.description:
Wake up early on weekdays. Stay up late on weekends. Sleep 9 hours a night and fit an extra 3 hours into each day.

This watchface divides the week into six 28-hour days instead of the standard 24/7. It works best if you have a somewhat flexible schedule, but can be tweaked to fit most lifestyles.

Feature requests are welcome :)

data.description:
Digital watchface where the display is a set of rectangular "rings", that, together, represent a fingerprint. The gaps create four numbers - hours at the top and minutes at the bottom. It’s completely cryptic for the untrained eye, so some practice is needed. 

Display can be in 12 or 24 hours, depending on the watch settings.

A configuration option allows the foreground color to be changed.

Screenshots show:
(1) 08:22
(2) 23:59
(3) 17:46
(4) 12:47 (with Quick View)

This design originally appeared on the Tokyoflash Design Studio and was created by Sam Jerichow and Peter Fletcher.   The watchface is published with the designers' permission, and sanctioned by Tokyoflash.

The original design found here:
http://blog.tokyoflash.com/2014/06/09/fingerprint-e-paper-watch-exposes-digital-time/

latest_release.release_notes: Added support for Pebble Time Round

data.title: Fingerprint

data.description:
A new Bible verse delivered daily to your wrist!

FEATURES:
• Over 150 Bible versions supported in 60 different languages
• Choose to receive a new verse every day, or display your favourite verse
• Battery and Bluetooth status indicators
• Clear, bold and classy 24h or 12h time display with date
• Many configuration options including Date Format, Verse Font Size, Scroll Speed etc
• Powered by BibleGateway.com

HOW TO USE:
• Shake/tap to show battery & Bluetooth indicators
• After ~1sec delay shake again (while battery & Bluetooth indicators are still visible) to show the verse
• The watchface will return to the main time display after a short 'reading' period -- alternatively a third shake will do the trick!
• Longer verses will automatically scroll

Feedback, bug reports and suggestions welcome - watch this space for updates!

latest_release.release_notes: Fixed broken configuration (settings) page

data.title: Verse Of The Day

Includes: Batman, Superman, Captain America, Wolverine, Iron man, Flash, Spiderman, Magneto, Hulk, Red Skull, Venom, Joker and many more (20 in total).
~170 frames of animation using animated PNGs.

Shows entire animation on launch, afterwards will advance 3 characters on flick (ie. conserves power).

data.description:
This watchface shows bluetooth icon when your phone is connected.
Also current battery level is shown. Both bluetooth and battery can be disabled in the settings menu.
It is possible to configure the shown weekday for the following languages:
english, german, italian.
Current seconds are shown as border "dots". border-dots can be disabled after a configurable amount of no movement or disabled entirely.
Sunrise and sunset can be displayed.
Therefore current GPS location will be loaded from your phone.
If no GPS location is available last stored version is used and shown with dashed icons.

latest_release.release_notes: * add danish language

data.description:
The new version of the FlexWatch has been redesigned, and extended with PebbleJS and still compatible with Android and iOS. The watch face itself is minimalistic, but you can customize the information that is shown to you in the new Setting window. Remember: Shake to show everything ;)

FlexWatch have some great features:
- Double vibration on connection loss (toggle)
- Longer backlight when shaking (5.5s, toggle)
- Charging bar
- Battery Status always displayed while plugged
- 12h time support (Thanks Scott)
- Settings Window
- Display Seconds (toggle)
- Local Weather (toggle)
- Custom Text (in settings)
- Vibrate on full hour (toggle)
- Invert Colors (toggle)
- Change BottomBar (Select)
- Change Font (Select)
- Weather Units (Thanks Scott K.)

Future Features:
- Raise to show / Raise to backlit (In FlexWatch Time)
- Battery saving mode (removed)

Version(s):
Android: 2.6
iOS: 2.3

ATTENTION: FlexWatch does NOT work on Pebble Time! I'm working on a special version of FlexWatch optimized for the new Pebble, compatible with all Pebble Models.

Special thanks to Bianca M. for the great help :)
Bluetooth icon from flaticon by GraphicsBay.

Thanks to: Russel, Adrian, Paul

Your location will be send to OpenWeatherMap.org if "weather" is enabled.

latest_release.release_notes:
- Ravenous Bottombar
- Languages Support (English, Italian, German, French, Spanish, Turkish)
- Change "show more" behavior

data.description:
This face displays the time in both 24hr and 12hr mode and uses vertical "elevator" animations to update the time. When multiple digits change at once, they'll move in directions opposite those of the digits next to them. The font used is called "Hauptbahnhof," which was created by Frédéric Rich and can be downloaded here: http://www.dafont.com/hauptbahnhof.font 

Any feedback is greatly appreciated!

data.description:
Excelsior

The hour is the dark section in the saucer found in the traditional analog watch positions. 
The 10-minutes are the digital number on the left nacell (bottom left) and the additional minutes on the right nacell (bottom right).
PM is indicated with a block on the fuselage (bottom middle).


Screenshots:  
(1) 10:29  
(2) 17:48 (displayed as 5:48 PM)  
(3) 06:13


This design was created by Peter Fletcher, from the UK, and originally appeared on the Tokyoflash Design Studio.  It is published with the designer's permission, and sanctioned by Tokyoflash. 

The original design found here: http://blog.tokyoflash.com/2014/05/23/wrist-wear-to-boldly-go/

To see other sanctioned Tokyoflash watchfaces, click on "More from this Developer".

data.description:
This is simple design watch composed of cells.

Upper circle cell means 10 digit, middle rectangle cell means 5 digit and lower rectangle cell means 1 digit.

Left block means Hour, middle block means Minutes and right block means Seconds.

Samples:
 1st screen shot:    12:17
 2nd screen shot:   19:35:21  
 3rd screen shot :   23:13:56

Revision History:
ver. 1.3:
     remember SETTINGS
ver. 1.2:
     add SETTINGS 
              - time type : system setting / 12h / 24h
              - second display : display / no display
ver. 1.1:
     add SETTINGS 
              - background color : black / white
              - edge line : display / no display

latest_release.release_notes: - update host server of setting page

data.title: CELL Clock

data.author: Ben Nguyen

changelog.release_notes: initial release

data.description:
Simple & subtle analogue watch with bold hands and dots. Aimed to be easy to see at a quick glance.

Features:
- Month & date
- Battery slider (dot moves from right to left, shows remaining battery)
- Bluetooth disconnect alert (vibrates and fill the black dot in the centre - 3rd screenshot)

Credits:
This watch uses the "absolute symmetry" idea from "Zen For Steel" (Richard Gilbert), hence the name; and the bold hands from "ONE" (Bert Freudenberg)

latest_release.release_notes: initial release

data.title: Zen Dotz

changelog.release_notes: Added support for Pebble firmware V4, Pebble 2 and Quick Views
Additional option to vibrate if bluetooth connection lost.   This version requires Pebble firmware 3.10 or later.
Following numerous requests, new configuration option added to display a large comet in foreground if bluetooth connection lost
Added support for Pebble Time Round

SDK 3 version with Aplite (black & white) and Basalt (color) formats.

Also fixed unreported bug where midday hour not being displayed.

data.description:
Time shown as large stars appearing on a star field.  Hours (blue/white) and 5-minutes (orange) appear in roughly the same positions as on an analog watch.  The additional 4 single minutes (orange), for accuracy, appear in the middle.

Configuration options to display a large comet in foreground and to vibrate if bluetooth connection lost.   Requires Pebble firmware 3.10 or later.

Screenshots show:  
(1) 10:19  
(2) 04:52  
(3) 09:46
(4) 05:29
(5) 09:53 (no bluetooth)

This watchface is published with the designer's permission, and sanctioned by Tokyoflash.   

The original design found here: http://blog.tokyoflash.com/2014/06/25/stars-watch-galactic-view-tells-the-time/


Design Copyright © 2014, 2015 Nev Rawlins
Programming Copyright © 2015 Nev Rawlins

latest_release.release_notes: Added support for Pebble firmware V4, Pebble 2 and Quick Views

data.description:
Digital version of Type-X.

One line of the “X” shape displays the hours in blue. The other line, divided into two by the hours, displays 5 x 10 minutes (bottom left) and 9 single minutes (top right) in red.  

Displays in 12 or 24-hours, depending on watch setting.

Screenshots show:
(1) 23:46 (24-hour) 
(2) 07:39 
(3) 09:16
(4) 16:22 (24-hour)
(5) 04:23

This design was created by Peter Fletcher and originally appeared on the Tokyoflash Design Studio.   This watchface is published with the designer's permission, and sanctioned by Tokyoflash.   

The digital version of Type-X  was in one of Peter's comments against the original design found here:  http://blog.tokyoflash.com/2014/05/28/type-x-watch-makes-its-mark-on-your-wrist/

For the original Type-X, and other sanctioned Tokyoflash watchfaces, click on "More from this Developer".

latest_release.release_notes: Added support for Pebble 2 and Quick Views

data.title: Type-X Digital

data.author: Nicholas Benander

changelog.release_notes: Build 1139802: Updated for Pebble 2.0

data.description:
Watchface uses divergent series numbers 1, 2, 4, 8, 16 and 32 to display the hour, minute, month and day. Numbers start from the bottom row with 1 and are added together vertically by column to achieve the actual value.

Column #1: Hour
Column #2: Minute
Column #3: Month
Column #4: Day

Watchface refreshes on the minute, not the second, to reduce power consumption and future updates may follow to reduce the computations during each refresh.

latest_release.release_notes: Build 1139802: Updated for Pebble 2.0

data.title: Divergent Bits

changelog.release_notes: - Changed layout to suit Danish pronunciation [Day>Date>Month].
- Danish only version.

data.description:
(Danish-only version of the original Battery Clock, created on request)

UPDATE 1.1 : Changed layout to suit Danish pronunciation [Day>Date>Month].

A clean and simple watch-face giving you all the information you need in a glance. 

Shows :

- Time (12h/24h depending on system setting)

- Full/Abv. Month of the year (space permitted)

- Day of the month

- Full/Abv. Day of the week (space permitted)

- Bluetooth disconnect indicator. Short pulse vibration for Bluetooth dis-connection.

And as the name suggests :

- Battery status (Shows the charge left. Also shows remaining charge percent and "Charging.." when plugged in). When battery level drops to 10% it will say "Charge me!" on the battery bar.

latest_release.release_notes: - Changed layout to suit Danish pronunciation [Day>Date>Month].

data.title: Battery Clock (Danish)

data.description:
This watch face will show time and day along with weather information.
The weather information is not shown by default after install,to see the current temperature just flick your wrist it will show the temperature information along with pebble lovely backlight.
The weather information updates as you flick your wrist.
If you face any issues  or want to provide any feedback you can reach me by clicking the Email Developer Link.
If you like this watch face click on the heart symbol :)..
More to come watch this space.
If you don't see temperature and location try by switching on the location services in mobile.

60 active users thank you all :)

latest_release.release_notes: Based on the user feedback changed the wind display from mp/h to km/h :)

data.description:
Shows wind direction and speed (Average and Gust) at your preferred location (or your device location).

+ You can set up-to 3 locations, and switch them using the app settings.

+ Shows also the weather conditions.

+ Zaps you when the wind is a above 12knots (configurable).

+ Perfect for wind and kite-surfers.

data.author: Joel Malissa

changelog.release_notes: This app was made at PennApps Winter 2015.

data.description: Does your watch tell time too well?  Are you one of the bajilllions of people that set it five minutes fast?  Have you ever been.... late to meetings, shows, or bat mitzvahs?  Never be late again with Time+!  By randomly adding up to ten minutes to the current time, Time+ forces you to overestimate the current time.  For an unlimited time only, this powerfully simple solution can be yours for free.

latest_release.release_notes: This app was made at PennApps Winter 2015.

data.title: Time+

data.author: Ian Harrison

changelog.release_notes: Fixed minor time display bug at X:00.

Choose your events!

Use the Settings page to enable/disable the events you are interested in.
When the SetPebble page appears, choose "Pebble Account Token" if you want the settings to apply to all your watches, or enter your serial number to change a single watch.

New name, new features!
Now counts down to the next big US-based MINI gathering in 2015.  List currently includes:
- MINIS on the Dragon April 29th (MOTD)
- A MINI Vacation in Vegas May 28th (AMVIV)   
- MINIS on Top June 19 (MOT)
- MINIS on the Mack July 31 (MACK)
- MINIS in the Mountains August 5 (MITM)
- MINIS in Foliage October 1 (MiF)
- MINIS in the Ozarks October 22 (MITO)
If you know of a large national or regional MINI event let me know and I'll add it to the list!
Tidied up messages while the event is running.

Added Battery indicator, Bluetooth connected indicator.  Changed typeface on time display, added AM/PM indication and a smaller seconds display.  Centered the hours:minutes portion of the time display better.
Bug fixes.

data.description:
New name, new features!
Now counts down to the next big US-based MINI gathering in 2015. List currently includes:
 - MINIs on the Dragon April 29th (MOTD)
 - A MINI Vacation in Vegas May 28th (AMVIV)
 - MINIs on Top June 19 (MOT)
 - MINIs on the Mack July 31 (MACK)
 - MINIs in the Mountains August 5 (MITM)
 - MINIs in Foliage October 1 (MiF)
 - MINIs in the Ozarks October 22 (MITO)
Use the Settings page to enable/disable the events you are interested in.
When the SetPebble page appears, choose "Pebble Account Token" if you want the settings to apply to all your watches, or enter your serial number to change a single watch.
If you know of a large national or regional MINI event let me know through the support email and I'll add it to the list!

latest_release.release_notes:
Choose your events!

Use the Settings page to enable/disable the events you are interested in.
When the SetPebble page appears, choose "Pebble Account Token" if you want the settings to apply to all your watches, or enter your serial number to change a single watch.

data.title: MINI Countdown
